channel.title: Posts on Susan Holmes: Data Science Repository
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Susan Holmes: Data Science Repository

item.title: Talks and videos
item.description:
Talks and videos 2017

Some slides from talks.

Banff,2017: A personal history of searching for treespace.

[Simons Workshop on Microbiome,2017]()

February, 2017, WidS: How many ways? (to analyse a microbiome data set.)

Joint Mathematics Meetings, 2017: Statistical Proof? The problem of irreproducibility

[MAA- special invited lecture, 2017: Statistical challenges in analysing the human microbiome]()

Some old talks about trees, immunology and cancer

Doom, NZ, 2003: Confidence statements for phylogenetics

KITP, Santa Barbara, MDS and distances for trees, 2001

Some talks that have videos associated to them

BIRS, Banff, 2017, February, A historical perspective on treespace.

Women in Data Science: Statistical Challenges in the Analysis of Biological Data

NIPS 2016 : Reproducible Research, the case of the human microbiome.

Waste not want not: using the data, all the data.

MBI Video Phylogenetic trees in the study of the human microbiome.
